com.apptentive.android.sdk.module.rating
Interface IRatingProvider

All Known Implementing Classes:
AmazonAppstoreRatingProvider, GooglePlayRatingProvider
public interface IRatingProvider

Provides a common interface for ratings providers to allow Apptentive to work with the multiple markets available on the Android platform.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String activityNotFoundMessage(android.content.Context context)
          Called if the startRating process does not successfully finish launching an activityContext.
 void startRating(android.content.Context context, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> args)
          Starts the rating process.
 

Method Detail

startRating

void startRating(android.content.Context context,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> args)
                 throws com.apptentive.android.sdk.module.rating.InsufficientRatingArgumentsException
Starts the rating process. Implementations should gracefully handle cases where not all required arguments are provided.

Parameters:
args - A list of keys and values which may have been provided at app initialization to allow the ratings provider access to additional information. The hash will, at a minimum, contain the 'name' of the app as passed to apptentive and the 'package' identifier of the app.
context - An Android Context used to launch the rating or provide dialogs or notifications.
Throws:
com.apptentive.android.sdk.module.rating.InsufficientRatingArgumentsException - Thrown when the implementation needs an argument that isn't provided.

activityNotFoundMessage

java.lang.String activityNotFoundMessage(android.content.Context context)
Called if the startRating process does not successfully finish launching an activityContext.

Parameters:
context - The current Activity Context
Returns:
The error message to display to users.
